author: Jonathan Allen
description: The bromance may be dead, but Republicans worry that an escalating feud between President Donald Trump and billionaire Elon Musk could live on, leaving collateral damage in its wake for weeks, months or even years.
title: Nervous Republicans flee Trump-Elon Musk blast radius

author: Phil Helsel
description: Harvard University on Thursday filed a legal challenge to President Donald Trump’s efforts to block visas for foreign students planning to attend the Ivy League college.“Singling out our institution for its enrollment of international students and its collaboration with other educational institutions around the world is yet another illegal step taken by the Administration to retaliate against Harvard,” Harvard President Alan M. Garber said in a letter to the campus community
title: Harvard files legal challenge to Trump's effort to block visas for international students

author: Scott Stump, TODAY
description: Michelle Obama is giving fans a glimpse at “The Look,” her new book coming out in the fall.
title: Michelle Obama looks to ‘reclaim’ her White House style with new book

author: Erik Ortiz
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: 'Jane,' ex-girlfriend of Sean Combs, testifies feeling financially threatened into 'freak offs'

author: Rebecca Cohen
description: A Texas woman died from an infection caused by a brain-eating amoeba days after cleaning her sinuses using tap water, according to a Centers for Disease Control and Prevention case report.
title: Texas woman dies from brain-eating amoeba after cleaning sinuses with tap water

author: The Politics Desk
description: The simmering tension between President Donald Trump and Elon Musk boiled over into a full-blown public brawl Thursday.
title: The Trump-Musk alliance implodes: From the Politics Desk

author: Aria Bendix
description: Insurance companies often refer patients to lists of providers who are unreachable, out of network or don’t accept new patients.
title: 'Ghost networks' are harming patients, but attempts to eliminate them have fallen short

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: Video game retailer GameStop said Thursday that it is investigating claims made by some customers that they received damaged Nintendo Switch 2 consoles
title: GameStop investigating claims that some Nintendo Switch 2 screens were damaged with staples

author: Dareh Gregorian
description: Trump said the Biden administration used an autopen to sign orders and pardons that the former president was not aware of — a claim Biden vigorously denies.
title: 'Biggest scandal in American history' or a 'distraction': A look at Trump's autopen claims

author: Suzanne Gamboa
description: The travel ban goes into effect on Monday, leaving many to fear a future in which they can't visit family or loved ones are unable to escape dire circumstances in their home countries.
title: Trump’s travel ban sparks confusion and fear among affected families

author: Steve Kopack
description: Tesla's shares have fallen 16% since CEO Elon Musk began bashing President Donald Trump's spending bill on May 27, and the stock remains about 33% lower since Inauguration Day.
title: Tesla stock sinks as Musk and Trump ridicule each other

description: NBC News Chief Justice and National Affairs Correspondent Kelly O’Donnell reports on the public feud between President Trump and Elon Musk. NBC News Senior National Political Reporter Sahil Kapur explains whether Musk’s call to “kill the bill” will have an impact on lawmakers.
title: Trump and Musk go ‘for the jugular’ as they exchange escalating attacks on social media

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A New York father and daughter whose bodies were found on a mountain in Maine earlier this week had planned the hike while on a work trip.
title: Father and daughter found dead on Maine hike were long drawn to mountain, family says

author: Andrew Greif
description: Future Hall of Fame quarterback Aaron Rodgers is signing with XXXX, according to XXXX.
title: Aaron Rodgers plans to sign with Pittsburgh Steelers, reports say

author: Matt Lavietes
description: The mother of three girls who officials say were killed by their father is calling for reforms to Washington state's Amber Alert system after her daughters' bodies were discovered and as officials search for the man. Whitney Decker believes her daughters may still be alive had the Washington State Patrol issued an Amber alert for them last week, her attorney told NBC affiliate KING of Seattle on Thursday.
title: Washington mom believes an Amber Alert may have saved her 3 daughters

author: Rob Wile
description: President Donald Trump has escalated his sudden rupture with Elon Musk by implying the government could sever ties with the tech titan's businesses.
title: As feud escalates, Trump implies government could cut contracts and subsidies to Musk's companies

author: Viola Flowers
description: A judge in Arizona on Wednesday ordered a temporary halt to the release of the records surrounding the death of the 3-year-old son of influencer Emilie Kiser.
title: Arizona judge temporarily blocks release of death records for 3-year-old son of influencer Emilie Kiser

author: Anna Kaplan, TODAY
description: Tom Felton is reprising his role as Draco Malfoy — this time on Broadway.
title: Tom Felton returning as Draco Malfoy for 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child' on Broadway

author: Scott Stump, TODAY
description: Veteran ESPN “SportsCenter” anchor Jay Harris shared that he has been diagnosed with prostate cancer and will undergo surgery.
title: ESPN anchor Jay Harris reveals he has prostate cancer

author: Amelia Lucas, CNBC
description: Procter & Gamble will cut 7,000 jobs, or roughly 15% of its non-manufacturing workforce, as part of a two-year restructuring program.
title: Procter & Gamble to cut 7,000 jobs as part of broader restructuring

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: San Antonio police apologized Thursday for saying the murder of Jonathan Joss wasn't a hate crime
title: San Antonio police walk back statement dismissing possible hate crime in Jonathan Joss' murder

author: The Associated Press
description: CHELMSFORD, Mass. (AP) — An immigration judge granted a bond on Thursday to a Massachusetts high school student arrested on his way to volleyball practice last weekend.
title: Immigration judge grants bond to Massachusetts teen arrested on his way to volleyball practice

author: Samantha Subin, CNBC
description: Palantir CEO Alex Karp said the artificial intelligence arms race between the U.S. and China will culminate in one country coming out on top.
title: Palantir CEO Karp says AI is dangerous and 'either we win or China will win'

author: Michael Wayland, CNBC
description: DETROIT — Stellantis is resurrecting its popular V-8 Hemi engine for its Ram 1500 full-size pickup trucks beginning this summer.
title: Ram resurrects Hemi engine for popular pickup trucks in 'Symbol of Protest'

author: Adam Reiss
description: The federal judge overseeing the sex trafficking trial of Sean "Diddy" Combs scolded his defense lawyers Thursday and warned he could be removed from the courtroom after he apparently flashed facial expressions at jurors.
title: Judge in Diddy trial warns he may be removed from courtroom after jury interactions

author: Viola Flowers
description: Osceola County Sheriff Marcos Lopez and others are facing charges in connection with an alleged massive gambling operation in central Florida, Attorney General James Uthmeier's office said Thursday.
title: Florida sheriff charged with racketeering in alleged massive gambling scheme

author: The Associated Press
description: Coco Gauff reached her second final at Roland-Garros by beating Loïs Boisson 6-1, 6-2 on Thursday to end the surprising, upset-filled run by a French wild-card entry who is ranked No. 361.
title: Coco Gauff advances to French Open final

author: Denise Chow
description: Earth’s atmosphere now has more carbon dioxide in it than it has in millions — and possibly tens of millions — of years, according to data released Thursday by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and scientists at the University of California San Diego.
title: Earth's atmosphere hasn't had this much CO2 in millions of years

author: Rebecca Shabad
description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump on Thursday sharply criticized Elon Musk after the Tesla CEO criticized the House-passed GOP policy bill as an "abomination."
title: Trump says he is 'very disappointed' in Elon Musk's attacks on the GOP policy bill

description: President Trump reacted to criticism Elon Musk had about the Republican's spending bill, saying he was "very surprised," but understands why he was upset by certain measures in the legislation.
title: Trump was 'very disappointed' by Elon Musk's criticism of GOP spending bill

description: President Trump reacted to criticism Elon Musk had about the Republican's spending bill, saying he was "very surprised," but understands why he was upset by certain measures in the legislation.
title: Trump was 'very disappointed' by Elon Musk's criticism of GOP spending bill

description: President Trump discussed his call with Chinese President Xi Jinping on trade and says the U.S. is in "very good shape" to reach a trade agreement between the two countries.
title: Trump says he had 'very good conversation' with Xi on trade

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump holds a bilateral meeting with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz at the White House.
title: Trump meets with German Chancellor Merz at the White House

author: Tyler Kingkade
description: University of California staff hope to use a class action lawsuit against Donald Trump and federal agencies to restore their research funding.
title: UC Berkeley researchers team up for first-of-its-kind lawsuit over Trump funding cuts

author: Aria Bendix
description: Four states petitioned the Food and Drug Administration on Thursday to lift its lingering restrictions on abortion pills.
title: Four states petition the FDA to lift abortion pill restrictions

author: Matt Lavietes
description: President Donald Trump announced Wednesday night that nationals from 12 countries would be banned from entering the United States starting on Monday.
title: What to know about Trump's new travel ban

author: David K. Li
description: The vest Matthew Broderick donned nearly for "Ferris Bueller’s Day Off" is up for auction at Sotheby's with an estimated price between $300,000 and $600,000.
title: Matthew Broderick's vest in 'Ferris Bueller’s Day Off' could sell for up to $600K at auction

author: Viola Flowers
description: Yulissa Escobar will not be finding love in the villa on Season 7 of "Love Island USA."
title: 'Love Island USA' contestant exits after clips of racist language surface online

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court ruled in favor of Catholic Church-affiliated charitable groups, saying they were wrongly denied religious exemptions from a Wisconsin tax that funds unemployment benefits.
title: Supreme Court rules that Catholic groups were unlawfully barred from a religious tax exemption

author: Kevin Collier
description: One of the few companies to specialize in iPhone cybersecurity said that it has uncovered evidence of a potentially groundbreaking hacking campaign.
title: Harris-Walz campaign may have been targeted by iPhone hackers, cybersecurity firm says

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: Countries across the world were in shock Thursday after President Donald Trump announced a travel ban on nationals from a dozen countries and the cancellation of visa programs for seven more.
title: Fury and resignation around the world as Trump's travel ban comes roaring back

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court threw out the Mexican government's lawsuit against U.S. firearms manufacturers accusing them of aiding and abetting gun violence.
title: Supreme Court rejects Mexico’s lawsuit against U.S. gun makers

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Thursday revived a woman's claim that she was discriminated against at work because she is straight.
title: Supreme Court revives straight woman's reverse discrimination claim

author: Reuters
description: A U.S. and Israeli-backed aid organization in Gaza said it was reopening two distribution sites a day after shutting them following deadly shootings.
title: U.S.-backed aid group in Gaza reopens sites after closures and delays

description: The lawyer for the family of the suspect accused of attacking a group of demonstrators in Colorado responded to the Trump administration's attempts to deport them. A federal judge temporarily barred the administration from deporting the wife and five children of Mohamed Soliman, the Egyptian national accused of the antisemitic attack in Boulder, Colo.
title: Lawyer for Colorado attack suspect's family comments on possible deportations

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Luigi Mangione wrote about plans to kill UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in his diary months before the healthcare executive was gunned down in New York City last year, state prosecutors alleged in a Wednesday court filing.
title: Luigi Mangione's alleged diary entries released in new court filing

author: Drew Weisholtz, TODAY
description: Matt Vogt, a 34-year-old dentist from Indianapolis, qualified for the U.S.
title: Dentist who recently lost his dad qualifies for U.S. Open

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: The suspect in the Boulder firebombing will appear in Colorado court on Thursday, as an attorney for his family, who are in Immigration and Customs Enforcement detention, calls for their release.
title: Boulder attack suspect to appear in court as family remains in ICE detention

author: Lillian Rizzo, CNBC
description: NBA teams notched $1.62 billion in sponsorship revenue this season — an increase of 8% since last year, and 91% from $850 million five years ago, according to third-party data firm SponsorUnited.
title: NBA team sponsorship revenue up 8% to $1.6B, boosted by jersey patches

description: After Bryana Bongolan's cross-examination, an accuser under the pseudonym "Jane" is expected to begin multiple days of testimony.
title: 'Jane' testifies Sean Combs threatened her if she refused sex with another man

author: Rob Wile
description: President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping held a phone call Thursday amid ongoing tensions between the two superpowers.
title: Trump and Xi talk on phone as tariff battle continues

author: Nat Sumon
description: A hungry elephant, covered in mud, devoured nine bags of sweet rice crackers, some sandwiches and dried bananas in a grocery shop in Thailand on Monday.
title: Bull in a china shop? No, it's an elephant in a grocery store

author: Reuters
description: LGBTQ people from around the world gather in Washington this week for a parade, a political rally and cultural performances marking WorldPride.
title: WorldPride gathers in Washington as Trump rolls back LGBTQ rights

author: Karen Gilchrist, CNBC
description: Use of low-cost e-commerce giants Temu and Shein has slowed significantly in the key U.S. market amid President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Chinese imports and the closure of the de minimis loophole, new data shows.
title: Shein and Temu see U.S. demand plunge as loophole for cheap goods closes

description: The Nintendo store in New York City opened its doors at midnight to a crowd of eager shoppers looking to buy the Switch 2. See the moment the first fan was able to get his hands on the new console!
title: See First Shopper Get His Hands on Switch 2 at NYC Store

description: Israeli forces have recovered the bodies of two hostages with dual Israeli-U.S. citizenship. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the remains of Judith Weinstein-Haggai and Gad Haggai were returned to Israel after a special operation in Gaza.
title: Israeli Forces Recover Bodies of 2 Hostages With US Citizenship

description: President Donald Trump issued a sweeping new travel ban that bars people from 12 countries, primarily in Africa and the Middle East, from entering the United States. It comes as Trump is also ordering his administration to investigate whether Biden’s aides “conspired to deceive the public about the former president’s mental state” and to look into his alleged use of an autopen to sign documents. NBC’s Peter Alexander reports for TODAY.
title: Trump Announces Sweeping US Travel Ban for 12 Countries

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Donald Trump announced a ban on nationals from 12 countries from entering the United States.
title: Trump travel ban on 12 countries and Harvard international student visas threatened: Morning Rundown

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: Job Corps program alumni and faculty are anxious about the looming end date as they scramble to provide assistance to students who have also relied on Job Corps for free housing and food.
title: 'A gut punch': Job Corps alumni and faculty lament Trump administration cuts to the program

author: Reuters
description: Russia’s Federal Security Service (FSB) spy service accused U.K. intelligence of using the British Council as cover to undermine Russia.
title: Russia targets teachers who cooperated with the British Council

author: Patrick Smith
description: The body of a mountaineer was recovered Wednesday after he fell 3,000 feet to his death from Alaska's Mount McKinley, North America's highest mountain, also known as Denali.
title: Mountaineer killed by falling 3,000 feet from North America's highest mountain

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: Thunder star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander has not had a typical rise to MVP status. Yet those who’ve been around the guard are hardly surprised by his individual success.
title: Thunder superstar Shai Gilgeous-Alexander was an MVP hiding in plain sight

author: Chloe Atkins
description: President Trump’s sweeping bid to deport foreign students who have condemned the war in Gaza has been brought to a standstill by federal judges.
title: Judges bring Trump’s sweeping plan to deport foreign students to a standstill

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump is signaling a new approach to selecting judges in his second term, departing from his first-term formula of younger up-and-comers, elite credentials and pedigrees in traditional conservative ideology and instead leaning toward unapologetically combative, MAGA-friendly nominees.
title: Trump aims to build a MAGA judiciary, breaking with traditional conservatives

author: The Associated Press
description: SEATTLE — Two men arrested in Washington state with an arsenal that included dozens of guns, explosives and body armor, along with Nazi paraphernalia, were former military members who attacked a soldier with a hammer while stealing gear from Joint Base Lewis-McChord last weekend, investigators say.
title: 2 arrested with arsenal and Nazi paraphernalia after base robbery were ex-military, prosecutors say

author: The Associated Press
description: At least 11 people are dead and more than 30 injured after a stampede on Wednesday as crowds tried to enter a cricket stadium in the southern Indian state of Karnataka, authorities said.
title: At least 11 people die in a stampede in India as fans celebrate cricket championship

author: The Associated Press
description: Vietnam has abolished its long-standing two-child limit to try and reverse declining birth rates and ease the pressures of an aging population.
title: Vietnam scraps two-child policy as aging threatens economic growth

author: Reuters
description: An Australian woman accused of using poisonous mushrooms to murder three elderly relatives of her estranged husband was cross-examined by the prosecution on Thursday, denying she had measured a “fatal dose” on her kitchen scales.
title: Australian murder suspect is cross-examined over poisonous mushroom meal

author: The Associated Press
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska — The crew of a cargo ship carrying 3,000 vehicles to Mexico, including 800 electric vehicles, abandoned ship after they could not control a fire aboard the vessel in waters off Alaska's Aleutian island chain.
title: 22 crew members rescued from lifeboat in North Pacific after ship carrying 3,000 cars catches fire

author: Matt Dixon
description: Democrats face a huge uphill climb in 2026 to retake Florida’s governorship for the first time in more than two decades, but David Jolly says he is up to the challenge.
title: Former Republican David Jolly launches longshot bid for Florida governor as a Democrat

author: Karen Gilchrist, CNBC
description: Use of low-cost e-commerce giants Temu and Shein has slowed significantly in the key U.S. market amid President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Chinese imports and the closure of the de minimis loophole, new data shows.
title: Shein and Temu see U.S. demand plunge on ‘de minimis’ trade loophole closure

author: Chantal Da Silva
description: Israel has recovered the bodies of two hostages with dual Israeli-U.S. citizenship, Judith Weinstein-Haggai and Gadi Haggai, whose remains were held by Hamas.
title: Israeli forces recover bodies of 2 hostages with U.S. citizenship held in Gaza

author: Julia Zhong
description: Three Māori lawmakers in New Zealand received record suspensions of up to three weeks on Thursday over a protest haka they performed in Parliament last year against a contentious bill.
title: Maori lawmakers suspended over protest haka performed in New Zealand Parliament

author: Paul Wagner, NBC Washington
description: WASHNGTON — Days before a Washington murder trial was to begin, prosecutors decided the evidence they had against the defendant — who was in custody for more than five years — was not good enough, and the victim’s family still wants an explanation.
title: 'Shameful': Washington murder case dismissed after DNA evidence is lost

author: The Associated Press
description: Leon Draisaitl scored on the power play in overtime, Stuart Skinner made 29 saves and the Edmonton Oilers came back to beat the defending champion Florida Panthers 4-3 in Game 1 of the Stanley Cup Final rematch on Wednesday night.
title: Oilers outlast Panthers, 4-3, in OT in Stanley Cup Final opener

author: Elyse Perlmutter-Gumbiner
description: President Trump directed an investigation into Joe Biden and officials in the former president's administration, accusing aides of using “autopen” signatures to cover his "cognitive decline," assert presidential power.
title: Trump orders an investigation into Biden and his alleged use of the autopen

description: Bryana Bongolan, a friend of Cassie Ventura, testified that Sean “Diddy” Combs allegedly held her over a 17th-story balcony in 2016 before throwing her onto the balcony’s furniture.
title: Witness alleges Diddy held her over 17th-story balcony

author: Becca Wood, TODAY
description: Spoilers ahead for the ending of the first “Wicked” movie and the Broadway musical.
title: ‘Wicked: For Good’ trailer welcomes back Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande

author: Alex Tabet
description: A casual viewer could be forgiven for mistaking Democrats’ first New York City mayoral debate for the roast of Andrew Cuomo.
title: Andrew Cuomo faces attacks from all sides as New York City Democrats hold a raucous mayoral debate

author: Phil Helsel
description: President Donald Trump said Wednesday that he will deny visas for foreign students trying to come to the United States to attend Harvard University, his latest attack on the prominent Ivy League college.
title: Trump moves to deny visas to Harvard's international students

description: During the first New York City Democratic primary debate for mayor, former Governor Andrew Cuomo said his biggest political regret was “the state of the Democratic Party.” His opponents quickly pointed to his handling of the Covid-19 pandemic and the sexual harassment allegations he faced.
title: Cuomo says his biggest political regret is 'the state of the Democratic Party'

author: The Associated Press
description: A Texas hospital that repeatedly sent a woman who was bleeding and in pain home without ending her nonviable, life-threatening pregnancy violated the law, according to a newly released federal investigation.
title: Texas hospital that discharged woman with doomed pregnancy broke the law, inquiry finds

author: Nnamdi Egwuonwu
description: President Donald Trump signed a proclamation Wednesday that bans nationals from a dozen countries, including Afghanistan, Haiti and the Republic of Congo, from entering the United States, framing the travel ban as necessary to fortify national security and building upon one of the most contentious policies of his first term.
title: Trump announces new travel restrictions on 19 countries, including 12 outright bans

author: Andrew Greif
description: Offensive pace and defensive pressure are hallmarks for the Thunder and Pacers as they begin the NBA Finals.
title: NBA Finals: Insiders break down the matchup between 'the two hardest-playing teams'

author: The Associated Press
description: Two people died Wednesday after a giant crane collapsed at the construction site for a new central Florida hospital, officials said.
title: Crane collapse kills 2 at Florida construction site, officials say
